items.title: METR: Claude Opus 4.5 has a 50% task completion time horizon of about 4 hours and 49 minutes, more than double that of Claude Opus 4 released earlier this year (@metr_evals)
items.summary:
@metr_evals:
METR: Claude Opus 4.5 has a 50% task completion time horizon of about 4 hours and 49 minutes, more than double that of Claude Opus 4 released earlier this year  —  We estimate that, on our tasks, Claude Opus 4.5 has a 50%-time horizon of around 4 hrs 49 mins (95% confidence interval of 1 hr 49 mins to 20 hrs 25 mins). While we're still working through evaluations for other recent models, this is our highest published time horizon to date. [image]

Welcome to 9to5Toys Battlestation Weekly – your go-to spot for the notable deals and latest releases in PC gaming at a glance every Saturday morning. Deals on last-minute gifts are still flowing, and we’ve been tracking a ton of standout offers over the past week. While Black Friday is officially in the rearview mirror, plenty of that pricing is still live on gaming laptops, desktops, accessories, Windows Copilot+ PCs, and more. Best Buy is also keeping the momentum going with its last minute Doorbusters on Apple gear, gaming hardware, and beyond. If you’re looking to upgrade your battlestation or lock in a solid last-minute gift, this week’s roundup has you covered.

more…

items.title: Electrified Weekly – EcoFlow DELTA Pro Ultra X power station exclusive $6,999 low, Navee XT5 Pro e-scooter, Anker SOLIX flash sale, more
items.summary:
Welcome to 9to5Toys Electrified Weekly – the best place to find all of this week’s best deals and new releases to electrify your life and protect Mother Nature. There’s been a ton of last-minute Christmas Green Deals this week that have given us plenty of low rates – many of which are ongoing until next week, so get into gear while you can to make this a greener Christmas to remember! Some notable surprises this week were the exclusive $1,300 savings on the EcoFlow DELTA Pro Ultra X power station at a new $6,999 low, Navee’s all-new XT5 Pro Electric Scooter getting its first discount, and so many more. And as a reminder, you can find all the ongoing sales on various Green tech from earlier in the month by heading to our dedicated e-bikes, EV, power stations, and tool hubs.

more…

items.title: Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $50 off w/ holiday delivery, Switch game deals, more
items.summary:
If you’re still looking to bring some magic from the Mushroom Kingdom home for Christmas, there are some great price drops on Nintendo gear, Switch games, and more up for grabs right now. Not the least of which is the $50 price drop on the Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle over at Best Buy.

items.title: You can still snag these Amazon tech finds as last-minute gifts under $50 that arrive before Christmas
items.summary:
We’ve already shared our holiday favorites for Apple fans, content creators, gamers, and so on, with dedicated gift guides. Now, as we enter the final stretch of holiday shopping and your budget is starting to get thinner after all the shopping, we got just the right round-up for you with last-minute tech finds you can still grab for under $50 – all with Christmas delivery. You’ll also find some super affordable under $10 items thrown into the mix there to fill those stockings.

items.summary:
While the recent and particularly notable $200 price drop on Apple’s latest M3 iPad Air at Target is just about entirely sold out now, Amazon has now dropped the 1TB model to the lowest price it has offered at nearly $200 off as well.

items.title: 9to5Toys Steals Weekly – Retractable 67W wall charger $20, Qi2 3-in-1 charging station $24, fleece hoodies $20, more
items.summary:
Welcome to 9to5Toys Steals Weekly – your go-to spot for already-affordable everyday essentials that are now selling for even less. This weekly roundup pulls together all of the Steals from the past week, and puts them in a digestable list for you to consume every Saturday morning. Standout Steals lately include Baseus’ 67W retractable USB-C charger for $20, LISEN’s collapsible 3-in-1 Qi2 MagSafe charging station at $24, and a variety of fleece hoodies from $20. As usual, you can find these and many more down below.

items.title: Score these last-minute stocking stuffers from Amazon and get them in time for Christmas – all starting from $5
items.summary:
Today, Amazon has launched a 24-hour last-minute Prime Day event to finish up your Christmas shopping before next week. Amongst the sale, countless stocking stuffer deals will be delivered by next week’s holiday, giving you a final Hail Mary chance to pick up more budget-friendly items that start from under $5. We’ve collected a number of great picks for you below, broken down into four different sections of price ranges, so jump on it and grab what you need to make this a Christmas to remember!

items.title: Sony Officially Acquires The Peanuts Franchise For RM1.86 Billion
items.summary:
Japanese electronics giant Sony has officially taken majority control of Charles Schulz’s Peanuts franchise. The acquisition is valued at £340 million (~RM1.86 billion), and includes two of the franchise’s most popular characters, Snoopy and Charlie Brown. Sony reportedly bought 41% of Peanuts Holdings from WildBrain, the Canadian children’s entertainment company. In doing so, it raises […]

items.title: Selangor JPJ Officers Begin Using Body-Worn Cameras During Enforcement Ops
items.summary:
Road Transport Department (JPJ) enforcement officers in Selangor have begun wearing body-worn cameras (BWCs) while on duty, marking a new step towards improving transparency, accountability, and integrity during enforcement operations. The rollout started earlier this week and applies to officers conducting routine checks and enforcement activities across the state. Selangor JPJ director Azrin Borhan said […]

items.title: You can now access all Babbel language lessons through this exclusive offer from StackSocial
items.summary:
Learning a new language is tough, but some apps might be making it harder than it needs to be. Instead of rote memorization and hours of boring grammar exercises, try an app with a more practical approach. Babbel is a trusted language-learning tool with beginner-friendly lessons in 14 different languages, and you can get a lifetime subscription for only $159 (reg. $646.20), but that won’t last much longer.
